meanings.definition: A common refractive error of the eye resulting in blurred or distorted vision.
meanings.sent1: Her astigmia made it difficult for her to see clearly without glasses.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist diagnosed her astigmia during the eye examination.
meanings.sent3: Despite her astigmia, she found humor in trying on different pairs of glasses.
meanings.sent4: The astigmia of reality distorted her perception of the world around her.
meanings.sent5: The astigmia in her vision created a dream-like quality to everything she saw.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the cornea or lens of the eye is not perfectly curved, causing light to be focused unevenly.
meanings.sent1: The astigmia in his eye caused light to scatter, leading to blurred vision.
meanings.sent2: The ophthalmologist explained how astigmia affects the way light enters the eye.
meanings.sent3: His astigmia was like a funhouse mirror, distorting everything he looked at.
meanings.sent4: The astigmia of his perspective made it hard for him to see things clearly.
meanings.sent5: The astigmia in the lens created a kaleidoscope effect in his vision.
